de.ovgu.dke.teaching.ml.tictactoe.api
Interface IPlayer

All Known Implementing Classes:
KeyboardPlayer, LearningPlayer, RandomPlayer, ShallowPlayer, SmartPlayer
public interface IPlayer

TicTacToe Player Interface. This interface represents the capabilities of a TicTacToe player. A class that implements this interface has to provide a name for the player and a method that is able to compute the next move given the current board position of the game.

Author:
Thomas Low (thomas.low@ovgu.de)

Method Summary
 String getName()
          Returns the name of the player.
 int[] makeMove(IBoard board)
          Asks a player for its next move on the current TicTacToe board.
 void onMatchEnds(IBoard board)
          Is called when a match ended, meaning the player won, lost or the match was a draw.
 

Method Detail

getName

String getName()
Returns the name of the player.

Returns:
a string representing the name of the player

makeMove

int[] makeMove(IBoard board)
Asks a player for its next move on the current TicTacToe board. If an invalid move is returned, the player loses the game. A move is represented as coordinates of the field on the board. Coordinates are encoded as an array of indices from [0..size-1]. See also RandomPlayer for an example implementation.

Parameters:
board - the current board of the game (read only). Use clone() in order to get a write-able board instance.
Returns:
the coordinates of the players next move.

onMatchEnds

void onMatchEnds(IBoard board)
Is called when a match ended, meaning the player won, lost or the match was a draw.

Parameters:
board - the final board of the match (read only)
